body_html:
Update: I've been able to build all minor versions of TF up to 1.12.0 (1.8.0, 1.9.0, 1.10.0, 1.11.0, and 1.12.0). They all appear to run a small test correctly. Here's my configuration so you can try to match most of it:
Ubuntu 18.04
GCC 7.3.0
Python 3.6.5
Environment: VirtualEnv
Bazel version: For TF v1.7.0, v1.8.0: 0.10.0. For TF v1.9.0: 0.11.0. For TF v1.10.0, v1.11.0, v1.12.0: 0.15.0 (Following: https://www.tensorflow.org/install/source#tested_source_configurations)
CUDA 9.2.88, cuDNN 7.1.4
Intel CPUs, NVIDIA GPUs

Here are some small caveats worth noting:
TF 1.8.0: Requires a patch with #18907, commit 26b2814
TF 1.9.0: Requires a patch with #20147, commit 1b79572 (HUGE THANKS TO @yongtang for both of these patches!)
TF 1.11.0: Requires commit 89979f4
TF 1.11.0 and 1.12.0: Requires that the virtual environment install Keras pip packages, keras_applications and keras_preprocessing (and maybe h5py?), per issue #21518

At this point, the most likely issue in @incite's original post is the Bazel version. I'd try changing that first.

body:
Update: I've been able to build all minor versions of TF up to 1.12.0 (1.8.0, 1.9.0, 1.10.0, 1.11.0, and 1.12.0). They all appear to run a small test correctly. Here's my configuration so you can try to match most of it:
Ubuntu 18.04
GCC 7.3.0
Python 3.6.5
Environment: VirtualEnv
Bazel version: For TF v1.7.0, v1.8.0: 0.10.0. For TF v1.9.0: 0.11.0. For TF v1.10.0, v1.11.0, v1.12.0: 0.15.0 (Following: https://www.tensorflow.org/install/source#tested_source_configurations)
CUDA 9.2.88, cuDNN 7.1.4
Intel CPUs, NVIDIA GPUs

Here are some small caveats worth noting:
TF 1.8.0: Requires a patch with #18907, commit 26b2814
TF 1.9.0: Requires a patch with #20147, commit 1b79572c2d4 (HUGE THANKS TO @yongtang for both of these patches!)
TF 1.11.0: Requires commit 89979f42e82
TF 1.11.0 and 1.12.0: Requires that the virtual environment install Keras pip packages, keras_applications and keras_preprocessing (and maybe h5py?), per issue #21518

At this point, the most likely issue in @incite's original post is the Bazel version. I'd try changing that first.
